Initial comments:This report is the result of a special monitoring survey conducted on November 21, 2023, at Lehigh Valley Hospital - Dickson City. It was determined the facility was not in compliance with the applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a special monitoring survey conducted on November 21, 2023, at Lehigh Valley Hospital - Dickson City. It was determined the facility was not in compliance with the applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction: 135.11 (a) LICENSURE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES:135.11  Policies and procedures (a) The surgical division of the 
medical staff shall develop written 
policies and procedures for surgical 
services. These policies shall be made 
available to the medical staff and 
surgical nursing personnel.Observations:Based on review of facility documents, medical records (MR), and staff interview (EMP) it was determined the facility failed to ensure the bovie handpiece was placed in the bovie holster when not in use for one of one medical records reviewed (MR1). Findings:Review on November 21, 2023, of the facility policy,  "Electrocautery Safety - Perioperative Services - Operating Room,"  last reviewed October 2021 revealed  "...III. Intervention / Guideline:  General Instructions: .... E. Place bovie handpiece in bovie holster or protection device when not in use.  ... Procedure "  A. Application Of Disposable Dispersive Electrode  Action  ... 7. Place bovie handpiece in bovie holster or protection device when not in use. Rationale / Precautions  7. To prevent accidental activation of electrode and injury to patient.  ..."Review on November 21, 2023, of MR1 revealed the patient was admitted to the facility on November 6, 2023, for revision right total knee arthroplasty. There was physician and nursing documentation that during the surgical procedure the patient's foot had been placed on the bovie handpiece. There was a bovie laceration to the right heel which measured about three centimeters. The area was cleansed and sutured. The surgical field was re-draped. Interview on November 21, 2023, with EMP3, at approximately 0900 confirmed the above findings. EMP3 revealed the bovie was not placed in the holster. During manipulation of the right leg by the surgeon, the foot was placed on the bovie handpiece. The bovie was activated and cut MR1's right foot. EMP3 revealed staff had turned the volume down on the bovie but heard it activate. The procedure was stopped, the foot was examined and an injury to the right foot was discovered. Plan of Correction - To be completed: 01/01/2024Following the event, electrocautery safety was discussed with involved surgeon and Operating Room (OR) staff. President, Patient Care Services Leadership, Surgical Services Director, and Chief Medical Officer reviewed the "Electrocautery Safety-Perioperative Services" policy.  It was determined that no revisions to the policy were needed.  Electrocautery safety was discussed at the Dickson City Executive Medical Leadership Committee on 11/28/2023.In December 2023, electrocautery safety will also be discussed at the following committees/meetings:- Dickson City Department of Orthopedics- Network Medical Executive Committee- Dickson City OR Committee - Network Perioperative Safety CommitteeOperating Room nurses, surgical techs, and surgical providers will receive education on the "Electrocautery Safety–Perioperative Services" policy.  This education was developed by the Director of Perioperative Services.Above Plan of Correction will be completed by January 1, 2024.MonitoringThe OR Director, or designee, will perform a minimum of 5 random OR observations weekly to ensure the bovie is placed in the holster when not in use. Fallouts will be addressed in real-time and corrective actions documented. This audit will continue for at least 3 months, at which time its frequency will be re-evaluated. Initial comments:This report is the result of a special monitoring survey conducted on May 17, 2023, at Lehigh Valley Hospital - Dickson City. It was determined the facility was not in compliance with the applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction: Initial comments:This report is the result of a special monitoring survey conducted on May 17, 2023, at Lehigh Valley Hospital - Dickson City. It was determined the facility was not in compliance with the applicable requirements of the Pennsylvania Department of Health's Rules and Regulations for Hospitals, 28 Pa Code, Part IV, Subparts A and B, November 1987, as amended June 1998.   Plan of Correction: 51.3 (l) LICENSURE NOTIFICATION:51.3 Notification (l) A health care facility may not  
commence the provision of new health  
care services or provide services in  
new beds until it has been informed by  
the Department that it is in  
compliance with all licensure  
requirements.Observations:Based on review of facility documents, medical records, and staff interview (EMP), it was determined, the facility failed to inform the Department of Health (Department) that a new C-arm was providing services to patients beginning February 28, 2023.   Findings include:Review on May 17, 2023, of the facility job description, "President, LVH," last reviewed December 5, 2022, revealed "...Job Summary  Provides visionary leadership to build and maintain an environment which attracts and retains employees committed to continuous quality improvement, innovation, creative problem solving, and the application of lean principles to achieve cost efficiencies in services provided. Participates in network-wide planning activities with a focus on their respective region. Represents the network with utmost professionalism.  ... Essential Functions ... Ensures compliance with applicable local, state, federal, and accrediting agency regulations and directives and initiates corrective action.  ... "Review on May 17, 2023, of the facility document, "Pain Management ... C-arm Notification," dated December 21, 2022, revealed the facility notified the Department of the intent to add a C-arm to the Pain Management Suite.Interview on May 17, 2023, at 1100, with EMP1 revealed the facility implemented the use of the new C-arm on February 28, 2023.  EMP1 confirmed the Department was not notified prior to the use of the new C-arm. EMP1 confirmed an attestation by the facility administrator was not completed to satisfy the facility's notice and approval requirements. Review on May 17, 2023, of MR1, revealed MR1 was admitted to the facility on February 28, 2023, for a Transforaminal Epidural Injection. There was documentation the new C-arm was used on MR1.Review on May 17, 2023, of MR2, revealed MR2 was admitted to the facility on February 28, 2023, for a Transforaminal Epidural Injection. There was documentation the new C-arm was used on MR2. Review on May 17, 2023, of MR3, revealed MR3 was admitted to the facility on February 28, 2023, for an Epidural Steroid Injection. There was documentation the new C-arm was used on MR3. Interview on May 17, 2023, at 1130, with EMP1 confirmed the new C-arm was used on MR1, MR2, and MR3 on February 28, 2023.  Plan of Correction - To be completed: 06/30/2023On 5/17/2023, Regulatory Manager met with LVH-Dickson City President and VP Nursing to discuss process for attestation submission.On 5/18/2023, attestation for new C-arm was submitted. The following Plan of Correction will be followed:1.	A spreadsheet has been created to track dates/timelines for the attestation process. The Regulatory Manager will meet with LVH-Dickson City President, VP of Nursing, Nurse Administrator to review.  2.	This process will be shared with LVH-Dickson City Leadership Meeting on June 16, 2023. 3.	The Regulatory Manager will submit attestations for new/replacement equipment prior to use.MonitoringThe spreadsheet will be reviewed monthly by the Regulatory Manager to ensure attestations are sent prior to equipment use.  This will be completed for 100% of the submitted narratives.
